comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Richard Bennett (May 21, 1870 – October 22, 1944) was an American actor who became a stage and silent screen matinee idol over the early decades of the twentieth century." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Bennett_%28actor%29 His wife was Adrienne Morrison, "a semi-successful stage actress" (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrienne_Morrison). They divorced in April 1925. A photo of her is here and here Barbara Bennett (August 13, 1906 – August 8, 1958) was one of their daughters, an actress as well (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Bennett). In 1925/1926, she was for a short time the dancing partner of Maurice Mouvet (“Maurice the Dancer”), see The Wicked Waltz and Other Scandalous Dances: Outrage at Couple Dancing in ... by Mark Knowles, Page 207. (See also a picture of her www.flickr.com/photos/puzzlemaster/4106396928/ with comment) Maurice Oscar Louis Mouvet was born on March 17, 1889 in New York City, and died on May 18, 1927 (age 38) in Lausanne, Switzerland. He was one of the inventors of the Apache dance in Paris 1908. www.imdb.com/name/nm0561099/ www.streetswing.com/histmai2/d2movet1.htm en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_%28dance%29 See extensive article about him in archive.woodbridgelibrary.org/Archive/TheWoodbridgeLeader... The photograph must have been taken circa 1925.

comment._content: The date on the negative is 3-16-25.
